back_cards.example_en: She voted against the new policy at the meeting.
The ladder was leaning against the wall.
The dark clouds stood out against the bright sky.
They stocked up on food against the coming storm.

back_cards.definition_en: In a legal or competitive context.
back_cards.example_en: The case was filed against the company for fraud.
She runs in the park every morning.
He runs a small bakery downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: To flow or move like a liquid.
back_cards.example_en: The river runs through the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: To compete in a race or election.
back_cards.example_en: They decided to run for class president.
The old car still runs smoothly.

back_cards.definition_en: An informal term for a man.
back_cards.example_en: That guy at the store was really helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to refer to a person in a casual way.
back_cards.example_en: Hey, guys, let’s grab some pizza tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a specific role or context.
back_cards.example_en: The delivery guy left the package at the door.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe someone with certain traits.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a funny guy who always makes us laugh.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for someone in a story or situation.
back_cards.example_en: Some guy was fishing by the lake all day.
We talked about our plans for the weekend.
She wandered about the garden, admiring the flowers.
The meeting lasted about an hour.
He wrote a book about climate change.
There’s a lot of excitement about the new park.

back_cards.definition_en: An instance or example of something.
back_cards.example_en: This is a clear case of misunderstanding.
The lawyer won the case in court.
She packed her clothes in a small case.
The detective worked on a missing person case.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of circumstances or conditions.
back_cards.example_en: In any case, we’ll meet at the café.
She asked a question about the homework.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic or issue under discussion.
back_cards.example_en: The question of funding was debated at the meeting.
There’s no question that she’s the best candidate.
The math question stumped the whole class.

back_cards.definition_en: An inquiry in a formal setting.
back_cards.example_en: The reporter raised a question during the press conference.
She found work as a graphic designer.

back_cards.definition_en: Effort or activity to achieve something.
back_cards.example_en: The garden required a lot of work to maintain.
His latest work is a bestselling novel.
We finished the group work before the deadline.
He leaves for work at seven every morning.
The stars were bright in the night sky.
We had a fun game night with friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A time of rest or sleep.
back_cards.example_en: She stayed up all night studying for the exam.
The concert was held on Friday night.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for darkness or mystery.
back_cards.example_en: The forest seemed eerie at night.
They live in a small house by the lake.
The old tree has lived for over a century.

back_cards.definition_en: To experience or lead a lifestyle.
back_cards.example_en: She lives a quiet life in the countryside.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform or broadcast in real-time.
back_cards.example_en: The band will play live on TV tonight.
He loves to live adventurously, always traveling.
The kids played a game of soccer in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A form of entertainment or sport.
back_cards.example_en: Chess is a game that requires strategy.
The basketball game went into overtime.
He was up to his usual games at the party.
She spent hours playing a new game on her phone.
